header_summary:
In a recent assembly of Bitcoin developers, a consensus was reached on employing BIP 9 for the cautious implementation of BIP 119, highlighting the community's dedication to careful and consensus-driven enhancements to the Bitcoin protocol. This approach, documented at [CTV Activation](https://ctv-activation.github.io/), showcases an inclusive methodology, seeking broad feedback to refine the network responsibly. In parallel, Ethan Heilman, Isabel Foxen Duke, et al. have undertaken a substantial revision of BIP 360, aiming to preemptively fortify Bitcoin against quantum threats without adopting post-quantum signature schemes, as detailed on [GitHub](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1670) and [BIP360.org](http://bip360.org). This effort introduces a new output type, "Pay-to-Tapscript-Hash (P2TSH)," to mitigate potential vulnerabilities, representing a proactive step towards quantum resistance.

Discussions within the Bitcoin development community also revolved around the exploration of new opcodes and their integration into Bitcoin's scripting language, emphasizing a year-long effort to understand their potential impact on the ecosystem. The conversation, aiming to enhance Bitcoin's functionality without compromising its decentralization, suggests a cautious yet innovative approach to development. Meanwhile, a novel Layer 3 protocol proposal addresses Bitcoin's inherent limitations, such as transaction speed and fees, through a trustless custodial mechanism, promising enhanced scalability and usability while preserving decentralization, detailed in a [GitHub Repository](https://github.com/ynniv/deposits/blob/60593299f2bd638712b2c9858d6d3e99c9c0c0bc/WHITEPAPER.md).

Moreover, a forward-looking discussion introduced a script-only transaction method to safeguard against quantum computing threats, using operations like OP_CTV and OP_TXHASH without new signatures, as elaborated at [Delving into Bitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/a-quantum-resistance-script-only-using-op-ctv-op-txhash-and-no-new-signatures/2168). Lastly, the contrast between BMAX and Hashpool in the blockchain and mining sectors reveals insights into economic behaviors and strategic decision-making within the cryptocurrency mining landscape, suggesting potential areas for development in reducing reliance on traditional financial systems and enhancing market liquidity for miners.

recent_posts.title: CTV activation meeting #1 Notes
recent_posts.summary:
- The meeting on December 18, 2025, focused on BIP 119's activation parameters.
- A consensus was reached to use BIP 9 with conservative parameters for implementation.
- The process emphasized collaborative, inclusive decision-making and community feedback.

recent_posts.title: Major BIP 360 Update
recent_posts.summary:
- Ethan Heilman and colleagues initiated a major rewrite of BIP 360 for Bitcoin's security.
- The update introduces "Pay-to-Tapscript-Hash" to protect against quantum vulnerabilities, not adding post-quantum signatures.
- It seeks feedback via GitHub and BIP360.org, adding Python and Rust test vectors for developer engagement.

recent_posts.title: op_ctv still has no technical objections
recent_posts.summary:
- A year was spent examining Bitcoin opcodes for ecosystem impacts.
- Proposed threshold rules aim to safely integrate new opcodes for Bitcoin.
- The emphasis is on cautious innovation without compromising network security.

recent_posts.title: A Proposal for Trustless Custody
recent_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a Layer 3 protocol to improve Bitcoin by enhancing trust and custody.
- It suggests auditable ledgers and a reserve proof system for non-reliant trust transactions.
- The approach includes a recovery system with multisig and voting for dispute resolution.

recent_posts.title: Major BIP 360 Update
recent_posts.summary:
- The discussion highlights an innovative method to protect cryptocurrency from quantum threats without traditional signatures.
- It introduces a multi-step secret reveal process using TXHASH for secure transactions against advanced quantum technologies.
- The approach focuses on script-only transactions with operations like OP_CTV and OP_TXHASH for quantum resistance.

recent_posts.title: BMAX: pricing “sats now vs sats later” via a mining sharechain (no L1 changes, no custodians, no oracles)
recent_posts.summary:
- Hashpool enables valuation of future mining shares at a discount via a marketplace.
- BMAX operates its own network, integrating Bitcoin nodes to autonomously settle contracts.
- The email explores economic rationale behind current higher payment for future value, emphasizing the time value of money.

active_posts.title: Motion to Activate BIP 3
active_posts.summary:
- BIP 3 was marked "Proposed" in March 2025, indicating completed work and subsequent adjustments.
- An active GitHub pull request #1820 seeks to activate BIP 3, drawing over 600 comments and wide support.
- Proposed changes to BIP 3 include new licensing terms and improved guidelines for proposal validation and acceptance.

active_posts.title: Hash-Based Signatures for Bitcoin's Post-Quantum Future
active_posts.summary:
- Hash-based cryptographic solutions are gaining attention for Bitcoin's quantum resistance.
- Optimizations can significantly reduce hash-based signature sizes, enhancing practicality for Bitcoin.
- The community is urged to discuss the viability of stateful versus stateless schemes for Bitcoin's future.

active_posts.title: Re: The Cat, BIP draft discussion.
authors: The Cat, BIP draft discussion Bitcoin Mechanic
active_posts.summary:
- The discussion focuses on the balance between Bitcoin's efficiency and its core values.
- "The Cat" proposal aims to improve network efficiency by deleting non-monetary UTXOs.
- Critics fear UTXO deletion compromises Bitcoin's decentralized nature and user rights.

active_posts.title: Dust Expiry: Clean the UTXO set from spam
active_posts.summary:
- A soft-fork proposal targets UTXO set expansion by introducing age-based expiration for dust outputs.
- The proposal responds to the UTXO set doubling in size since 2023, exacerbated by spam.
- It aims to allow the removal of old, small outputs by implementing a specific age threshold formula.

active_posts.title: Gossip Observer: New project to monitor the Lightning P2P network
active_posts.summary:
- The project monitors the Lightning gossip network, enhancing message propagation understanding.
- Findings show a decrease in convergence delay and potential network inefficiencies.
- Future plans include expanding infrastructure and welcoming community engagement for analysis.

active_posts.title: Understanding and Mitigating a OP_CTV Footgun: The Unsatisfiable UTXO
active_posts.summary:
- OP_CTV, as introduced in BIP119, emphasizes managing transaction inputs with multiple inputs.
- Incorporating at least two inputs in `OP_CTV` templates prevents permanently unspendable UTXOs.
- Further research into `OP_CTV` aims to enhance Bitcoin's security and transaction efficiency.

today_in_history_posts.title: BIP Proposal: Wallet Interface
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal defines a simple interface for Bitcoin wallets and applications.
- It aims for seamless use across Bitcoin applications and wallets by standardizing functions.
- Security and privacy concerns are emphasized due to external exposure of wallet functionalities.

today_in_history_posts.title: PoDLEs revisited
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Rusty Russell inquired if Taproot affects a heuristic from a paper.
- The response clarified Taproot does not change the heuristic's validity.
- Taproot helps keep private channels hidden by countering a specific tracking method.

today_in_history_posts.title: Timewarp attack 600 second grace period
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Matt Corallo's proposal focuses on improving Bitcoin mining efficiency by limiting `nTime` rolling.
- The testnet4 allows backward `nTime` adjustments up to 600 seconds to fix timewarp issues.
- Expanding the adjustment window to two hours could prevent exploits without compromising security.
